    • Blackjack

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> playerCards, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> dealerCards, java.util.Random rand)
      Starts the game by giving the player and the dealer two cards. One of the dealers cards is hidden to prevent the player from knowing exactly what the dealer has.
      Parameters:
      playerCards - The list of cards you want the player to have.
      dealerCards - The list of cards you want the dealer to have.
      rand - A random number generator to create the value for the cards given out to start the round.

    • playerHit

      public void playerHit​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> playerCards, java.util.Random rand)
      Gives the player an additional card.
      Parameters:
      playerCards - The ArrayList of player cards.
      rand - The Random number generator used to assign the card to the player.

    • dealerHit

      public void dealerHit​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> dealerCards, java.util.Random rand)
      Once the player has chosen to stay, the dealer draws additional cards using this method until the sum is greater than 17.
      Parameters:
      dealerCards - An Arraylist of the dealers individual cards.
      rand - The random number generator used to generate each card.

    • compareCards

      public int compareCards()
      Compares the sum of player cards and the sum of dealer cards.
      Returns:
      An integer value as a usable repsentation of the comparison. between the sum of player cards and the sum of dealer cards. The results are as follows: 1 - player sum > dealer sum 0 - player sum = dealer sum -1 - player sum < dealer sum

    • checkAce

      public void checkAce​(int ace, java.util.Scanner scan)
      Checks if the user has an Ace and Asks if they would like its value to be 1 or 11. This only occurs once per ace card.
      Parameters:
      ace - The integer flag used to determine if the player has an ace or not.
      scan - The scanner used to read user input.

    • aceChecked

      public boolean aceChecked()
      If the ace has already been checked, return true, return false if it hasn't
      Returns:
      Returns true if there is an ace in the deck that has already been checked and no longer needs a user prompt.

    • getPlayerCards

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getPlayerCards()
      Outputs the players current cards.
      Returns:
      The ArrayList of individual player cards.

    • getDealerCards

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getDealerCards()
      Outputs the dealers current cards.
      Returns:
      The ArrayList of individual dealer cards.

    • getPlayerSum

      public int getPlayerSum()
      Outputs the sum of the players current cards.
      Returns:
      The integer sum of the players current cards.

    • getDealerSum

      public int getDealerSum()
      Outputs the sum of the dealers current cards.
      Returns:
      The integer sum of the players current cards.

    • getAceChecked

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAceChecked()
      Used to check if an ace has already been checked.
      Returns:
      Returns the ArrayList of checked cards.

    • setDealerCards

      public void setDealerCards​(int index, int value)
      Allows the user to change the value of a specific dealer card.
      Parameters:
      index - The index value of what card you would like to change.
      value - The value of what you want the card to be at the given index.

    • setDealerSum

      public void setDealerSum​(int dealerSum)
      Allows the user to change the value of the dealers sum of cards.
      Parameters:
      dealerSum - What you would like the dealers sum of cards to be.

    • setPlayerCards

      public void setPlayerCards​(int index, int value)
      Allows the user to change the value of a specific player card.
      Parameters:
      index - The index value of what card you would like to change.
      value - The value of what you want the card to be at the given index.

    • setPlayerSum

      public void setPlayerSum​(int sum)
      Allows the user to change the value of the players sum of cards.
      Parameters:
      sum - What you would like the players sum of cards to be.
